bug.description:
Describe the bug Open3d can't write or open properly a mesh (created from a point cloud using the pivoting ball function) which has been sharpened. It can write a .ply mesh file, however when visualizing it, its just a bunch of random triangles. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Load point cloud: pcd = o3d.io.read_point_cloud( os.path.join(".ply") )
Convert point cloud into a mesh: mesh = o3d.geometry.TriangleMesh.create_from_point_cloud_ball_pivoting (pcd, o3d.utility.DoubleVector([1,2,3,4])) print(np.asarray(mesh.vertices)) print(np.asarray(mesh.triangles)) mesh = o3d.geometry.TriangleMesh.compute_triangle_normals (mesh)
Visual check if the mesh has been created properly: o3d.visualization.draw_geometries ([mesh])
Sharpening of the mesh mesh = mesh.filter_sharpen(number_of_iterations=1, strength=0.005)
Saving of the sharpened mesh o3d.io.write_triangle_mesh( os.path.join(path, "meshes/", ".ply"), mesh)
Opening of the saved sharpened mesh mesh = o3d.io.read_triangle_mesh( os.path.join(path, "meshes",".ply") ) o3d.visualization.draw_geometries([mesh])
Expected behavior Open3D is able to properly load the point cloud, create the mesh and sharpen the mesh. However, it is unable to properly save the sharpened mesh or read the not-properly saved mesh.
Screenshot of the sharpened mesh: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57444293/68300892-001e3080-009f-11ea-944d-48d43462b0a5.png></denchmark-link>
Screenshot of the experienced bug when loading a saved sharpened mesh: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57444293/68300929-17f5b480-009f-11ea-8ee1-74ecdb7b4afa.png></denchmark-link>
Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS Python version:3.6 Open3D version: 0.8.0 Is this remote workstation?: no How did you install Open3D?: pip
Additional context When saving the sharpened mesh the terminal outputs the following statement multiple times: RPly: Failed writing green of vertex 56040 (binary output: uchar) RPly: Failed writing red of vertex 56041 (binary output: uchar) RPly: Failed writing blue of vertex 56056 (binary output: uchar) RPly: Failed writing vertex_indices of face 0 (binary output: uchar) As well as when opening the saved sharpened mesh: RPly: Error reading 'vertex_indices' of 'face' number 93304 [Open3D WARNING] Read PLY failed: unable to read file: Thanks a lot for your time!

Ok, two things coming together here. After filter_sharpen the vertex_colors can get out of bounds [0,1]. However, write_triangle_mesh with ply as format expects that the color values are in that range, otherwise you get the warnings you see in your terminal. A quick fix is to add mesh.vertex_colors = o3d.utility.Vector3dVector( np.clip(np.asarray(mesh.vertex_colors), 0, 1) ) after the call to sharpen. You might want to re-normalize the normals, too. I will submit a PR to fix the problem in writing meshes to ply soon.
